result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Lafferty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of the September 7, 2016 Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable David J Wambach

[MK] cases #15CM323, #15CM325, #15CM425, #16CF229, #16CM27, #16CM291 called at 2:28pm.
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court, in custody, with Attorney Anthony J Jurek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teueber verifies victim rights compliance as to all cases. The victim impact statement is submitted as to Case 15CM325.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #16CF229- Counts #2 & #6.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.  Mr. Lafferty makes a statement.


On Case #16CF229 -Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Lafferty to  2 years and 0 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months. 
The Court orders as a separate stand-alone order in Case #16CF229-Count #1:  6 months drivers license revocation. 
On Case #16CF229 -Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Lafferty to  2 years and 0 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months.  This sentence is concurrent to Count #1.

The Court finds that Mr. Lafferty  is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Lafferty is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  88 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders as condition of Extended Supervision on each count:
--to pay costs, fees, assessment 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

On Case #16CF229-Counts #4 & #5 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years, with the condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments
Days credit for time already served:  88 days 

On Case #15CM323 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years, with the condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments including $66 in subpoena fees
Days credit for time already served:  2 days 

On Case #15CM325-Counts #1, #2, & #3 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years, with the condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments 
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 

On Case #15CM425 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for one year, with the condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments including $43 in subpoena fees
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 

On Case #16CM27-Counts #1 & #2 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years, with condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments including $30 in subpoena fees
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 

On Case #16CM291-Counts #1 & #2 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years with condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 



The Court determines that Mr. Lafferty already has a DNA sample on file, so the Court does not require DNA sample provision in these cses. 
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 3:53pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 16CF229,16CM291,16CM27,15CM425,15CM323,15CM325 called together at 4:09pm [MA]
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court, in custody with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock indicates that there is victim rights complinace in all cases except 15CM325.

The Court will take pleas on all cases today; if the victim wishes to be present for the entrance of plea on case 15CM325, the Court will revisit that issue at the sentencing hearing.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; factual basis stipulated; 

As to Case 15CM325, Counts #1, #2, and #3: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 
As to Case 16CM27, Counts #1 and #2: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 
As to Case 16CM291, Counts #1 and #2: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 
As to Case 15CM425, Count #1: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 
As to Case 15CM323, Count #1: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 

As to Case 16CF229:
Mr.Lafferty waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

recess: 4:35pm--reconvene: 4:39pm
Arraignment as to Case 16CF229:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

As to Case 16CF229, Counts #1, #3, #4, and #5: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 

The Court will hold in abeyance all counts to which Mr. Lafferty has not plead to at this time.

The Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Lafferty guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court directs Counsel to contact the Court's JA to schedule the sentencing hearing

recess: 4:43pm

NEXT: Counsel to contact Court's JA to schedule sentencing, this sentencing is to take priority. JA please note: to address counts which pleas were not taken.
from Attorney Jurek re: Court's scheduling order
Jury trial on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Cases 15CM323, 15CM325, 15CM425, 16CM27 called together at 9:43am [mo]
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Jurek indicates that resolution has not been reached; requests trial be scheduled in one case.

The Court schedules all cases for trial
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court distributes its scheduling order.
recess: 9:56am

Case 15CM325: (1)FSSC on 8/8/16 at 3:00pm (2) Jury Trial on 8/11 or 8/12/16 at 8:30am
Case 15CM425: (1)FSSC on 8/29/16 at 3:00pm (2) Jury Trial on 9/1/16 at 8:30am 
Case 16CM27: (1)FSSC on 9/12/16 at 3:00pm (2) Jury Trial on 9/15 or 9/16/16 at 8:30am
Status conference on May 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Cases 15CM425, 15CM323, 15CM325, and 16CM27 called together at 11:09am [mo]
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 16CM27:
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Tyler Leonsteiner
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 11:16am


NEXT:  AS TO ALL CASES: Status Conference on 5/24/16 at 9:30am
